intro: Tibetiodes himalaica, commonly known as the Himalayan bellflower, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. Tibetiodes himalaica is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in alpine gardens.
